content:
• Thursday, December 8, 2011
  • AOBC

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC) posts a mixed FQ2, meeting EPS estimates but missing on revenue. Gross...

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC) posts a mixed FQ2, meeting EPS estimates but missing on revenue. Gross profit was 26.7% of sales, down from 30.4% for the year-ago quarter, reflecting the impact of costs associated with a product recall as well as the consolidation of its Thompson/Center Arms business to Springfield, Massachusetts. The company also lowers guidance, now expecting FQ3 sales to be between $92M - $96M, below Street estimates of $101M. Shares -1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:57 PM
  • FLOW-OLD

    Flow International (NASDAQ:FLOW-OLD) FQ2 beats across the board as profit rose 22% Y/Y on...

    Flow International (NASDAQ:FLOW-OLD) FQ2 beats across the board as profit rose 22% Y/Y on significantly higher sales from its standard segment. Gross margins widened on the jump in revenue to 39.2% from 37.5%. Shares +30% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • CMTL

    Comtech Telecom (NASDAQ:CMTL) drops 4.6% AH after reporting FQ1 results. While revenue of...

    Comtech Telecom (NASDAQ:CMTL) drops 4.6% AH after reporting FQ1 results. While revenue of $113.4M (-36% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.41 beat by a healthy $19.9M and $0.11, the company is maintaining its FY12 (ends July '12) revenue guidance of $400M-$430M, and just slightly lifting its EPS guidance to a range of $1.25-$1.37 ($1.20-$1.32 prior), citing macro fears and federal budget uncertainty. (M&A hopes)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • FURX

    Furiex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:FURX) announces its PPD-10558 drug for treating statin-associated...

    Furiex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:FURX) announces its PPD-10558 drug for treating statin-associated myalgia "did not meet its primary efficacy endpoint" during Phase II trials. As a result, Furiex will discontinue further development work on PPD-10558. Shares are currently halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • GRPN

    A flower growing in today's stock market wreckage: Groupon (GRPN +5.3%), a day after...

    A flower growing in today's stock market wreckage: Groupon (GRPN +5.3%), a day after LivingSocial disclosed it’s raising another $400M in private funding, meaning GRPN’s key rival may not pursue its own IPO any time soon. But Benchmark thinks there may be more to the story: "Groupon is innovating, expanding and growing... distancing itself from LivingSocial."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM | 2 Comments
  • TXN

    Texas Instruments (NYSE:TXN) drops 6.6% AH after using its mid-quarter update to guide for Q4...

    Texas Instruments (NYSE:TXN) drops 6.6% AH after using its mid-quarter update to guide for Q4 revenue of $3.19B-$3.33B and EPS of $0.21-$0.25, below prior guidance ranges of $3.26B-$3.54B and $0.28-$0.36. TI blames the shortfall on "lower demand across a wide range of markets," save for wireless application processors. Between TI and Altera's (NASDAQ:ALTR) warnings (previously), chip stocks are likely to see weakness tomorrow. (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 2 Comments
  • INTC

    Altera (NASDAQ:ALTR) drops 4.3% AH after warning Q4 revenue will decline 13%-16% Q/Q, worse than...

    Altera (NASDAQ:ALTR) drops 4.3% AH after warning Q4 revenue will decline 13%-16% Q/Q, worse than prior guidance for a 7%-11% drop. The company, which previously claimed its sales weakness was due to oversized inventory drawdowns, blames its guidance cut on a deteriorating revenue outlook "across all major vertical markets," thanks to macro issues and weaker-than-expected customer sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • SMRT

    Fashion apparel retailer Stein Mart (NASDAQ:SMRT) says it will restate its FQ3 and year-to-date...

    Fashion apparel retailer Stein Mart (NASDAQ:SMRT) says it will restate its FQ3 and year-to-date results, on account of understated merchandise unit balances in an inventory system, which in turn led to understated markdowns. The company claims the additional markdowns will affect 2011 EPS by $0.03-$0.04. Shares remain halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • ESL

    Esterline (NYSE:ESL) reports Q4 EPS of $1.21 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $502M misses by $22M....

    Esterline (NYSE:ESL) reports Q4 EPS of $1.21 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $502M misses by $22M. Shares -2.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • MTG

    MGIC Investment (MTG +0.6%) ekes out a small gain in a weak tape today after saying its primary...

    MGIC Investment (MTG +0.6%) ekes out a small gain in a weak tape today after saying its primary delinquent inventory - those policies where homeowners were behind on payments - declined slightly during November.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • BAC

    Bank stocks (XLF -3.8%) sink to session lows after Germany rejects giving the ESM a banking...

    Bank stocks (XLF -3.8%) sink to session lows after Germany rejects giving the ESM a banking license: BAC -5.3%, C -6.9%, GS -4.9%, JPM -5.2%, MS -8.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • NKTR

    Nektar Therapeutics (NKTR +0.8%) is a beneficiary of the FDA's approval of Affymax's (OTC:AFFY...

    Nektar Therapeutics (NKTR +0.8%) is a beneficiary of the FDA's approval of Affymax's (OTC:AFFY +35.4%) peginesatide treatment of anemia in dialysis patients. Nektar has an exclusive agreement under which it will provide Affymax with its proprietary technology for use in the drug's manufacture in exchange for manufacturing revenue, milestone and other payments.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • SEEL

    Apricus Bioscience (APRI +1.2%) says the Japanese Patent Office has issued an official decision...

    Apricus Bioscience (APRI +1.2%) says the Japanese Patent Office has issued an official decision to allow the company's application covering compositions and methods related to Crystalline Salts and its NexACT permeation enhancer technology used in topical drug delivery.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • NVS

    Shares of Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY +0.7%) and Novartis (NVS -0.1%) outperform the general market...

    Shares of Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY +0.7%) and Novartis (NVS -0.1%) outperform the general market today, after a report released late yesterday at the San Antonio Breast Cancer Symposium showed that drugs the two companies are developing targeting different drivers of breast cancer slow tumor progression.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • ALXA

    Shares of microcap Alexza Pharmaceuticals (ALXA -44.5%) implode after the FDA issues a scathing...

    Shares of microcap Alexza Pharmaceuticals (ALXA -44.5%) implode after the FDA issues a scathing report (.pdf) that says the firm's inhaled antipsychotic drug places some patients at risk for respiratory failure. "It is likely that, even with adequate screening for pulmonary risk factors, some patients will require respiratory support post-dose, and some patients will be at risk for respiratory failure and death."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • BAC

    "Of course" CEO Brian Moynihan's job is safe, Bank of America (BAC -3.6%) Chairman Charles...

    "Of course" CEO Brian Moynihan's job is safe, Bank of America (BAC -3.6%) Chairman Charles Holliday tells CNBC. "He’s put things in place [and has] a great team there." On whether BofA will sell its Merrill Lynch brokerage, Holliday can't discuss details, but says it's a good fit: "If we just sell to our own customers, we have a great growth opportunity here in the U.S."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 2 Comments
  • TVTY

    Healthways (HWAY +5.6%), which was crushed in October on news of a Cigna (NYSE:CI) contract...

    Healthways (HWAY +5.6%), which was crushed in October on news of a Cigna (NYSE:CI) contract loss, rallies after Stifel upgrades shares to Buy and lifts its PT to $13. The firm notes Healthways' margins have held up well in the face of declining revenue, and thinks improving jobs data bodes well for the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • ECA

    Encana (ECA -5.7%) shares stumble after the EPA says in a draft report the aquifer in a Wyoming...

    Encana (ECA -5.7%) shares stumble after the EPA says in a draft report the aquifer in a Wyoming gas field operated by the company "contains compounds likely associated with gas production practices, including hydraulic fracturing." EPA says Encana has been funding the provision of alternate water supplies to the area since 2010. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM | 36 Comments
  • SXC

    SunCoke Energy (SXC +0.5%) clings to positive territory after being initiated with an Outperform...

    SunCoke Energy (SXC +0.5%) clings to positive territory after being initiated with an Outperform at Oppenheimer, saying it's the largest independent producer of metallurgical coke in North America, holding 50+ years worth of coal reserves.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM
  • AUO

    AU Optronics (AUO -7.2%) trades lower after announcing its November preliminary consolidated...

    AU Optronics (AUO -7.2%) trades lower after announcing its November preliminary consolidated revenue came in at NT$30M, down 2% M/M and 17.1% Y/Y. Results were hit by lower-than-anticipated shipments of small and medium sized panels.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • CBRL

    Cracker Barrel (CBRL -1.2%) gains the support of influential shareholder advisory firm ISS, as...

    Cracker Barrel (CBRL -1.2%) gains the support of influential shareholder advisory firm ISS, as the restaurant chain attempts to fend off a proxy fight with activist investor Sardar Biglari. It's a blow to Biglari, who had been seeking a board seat by ousting Charles Jones, head of CBRL’s compensation committee.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • NE

    Shares of Noble (NE -4.5%) drop after S&P cuts its credit ratings one notch, lowering it to...

    Shares of Noble (NE -4.5%) drop after S&P cuts its credit ratings one notch, lowering it to triple-B-plus from A-minus, citing soft industry conditions and a more aggressive financial policy that will lead to a higher debt to EBITDA ratio.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • KEYW

    KEYW, a provider of network security solutions for defense and intelligence agencies, is up 10%...

    KEYW, a provider of network security solutions for defense and intelligence agencies, is up 10% after announcing a stock buyback program good for 2M shares. 11.6% of the company's float was shorted as of Nov. 15; it's likely some of those shorts are covering today.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • THQIQ

    The crash in THQ (THQI -33.6%) that's followed the company's FQ3 warning (I, II) has sent shares...

    The crash in THQ (THQI -33.6%) that's followed the company's FQ3 warning (I, II) has sent shares below the $1 level. Pac Crest and Brean Murray are downgrading THQ to Hold, believing the company may soon have trouble meeting debt obligations. As for Cowen's Doug Creutz, who made a prescient downgrade on Tuesday, he thinks the FQ3 shortfall can't be solely attributed to weak uDraw tablet sales, as THQ claims.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • RIG

    Transocean (RIG -4.3%) is one of the day's largest large-cap losers after Goldman Sachs...

    Transocean (RIG -4.3%) is one of the day's largest large-cap losers after Goldman Sachs initiates coverage with a Sell rating. The firm notes that while RIG has dominated the ultra-deepwater business, its rigs need extensive upgrades to keep them compliant in the post-Macondo world - which consensus estimates don't fully reflect.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM
  • NBR

    Nabors Industries (NBR -3.4%) trades lower after Goldman initiates the shares with Neutral,...

    Nabors Industries (NBR -3.4%) trades lower after Goldman initiates the shares with Neutral, noting the company is in transition following the departure of its long-time CEO, and plans for improving the financial and operating performance of the company are still forthcoming.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • E

    Eni (E -4.5%) dips after its CEO says it's concerned that Iranian oil payments for previous work...

    Eni (E -4.5%) dips after its CEO says it's concerned that Iranian oil payments for previous work its done in the Islamic republic may be jeopardized by a potential EU ban. The EU is considering an oil embargo against Iran as part of sanctions against the country's nuclear program.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • CPTS

    Conceptus (CPTS -2%) remains in the red despite bouncing back from steep losses at the open...

    Conceptus (CPTS -2%) remains in the red despite bouncing back from steep losses at the open after saying its 2011 sales will fall short of previous estimates. The women's healthcare developer now expects 2011 sales between $126M - $128M, down from previous guidance of $132M - $136M, and below analysts' consensus of $132M. Separately, the company announces the appointment Keith Grossman as its President and CEO.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • EPD

    Enterprise Products (EPD -2.7%) trades lower after pricing its 9M share secondary offering at...

    Enterprise Products (EPD -2.7%) trades lower after pricing its 9M share secondary offering at $44.68 per common unit, a 2.7% discount to yesterday's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • CMLP

    Crestwood Midstream Partners (CMLP -2.9%) slips after being downgraded to Underperform on...

    Crestwood Midstream Partners (CMLP -2.9%) slips after being downgraded to Underperform on valuation at BofA/Merrill Lynch. Sound logic, as the stock has been on a tear recently, gaining over 35% since October.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • NRG

    NRG Energy (NRG -3.8%) slides after being cut to Neutral at UBS, saying lower commodity prices...

    NRG Energy (NRG -3.8%) slides after being cut to Neutral at UBS, saying lower commodity prices will negatively affect operating margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • VLO

    Valero Energy (VLO -4.6%) trades down after RBC cut the shares to Outperform earlier today and...

    Valero Energy (VLO -4.6%) trades down after RBC cut the shares to Outperform earlier today and removed it from its top pick category. The firm notes heavy/sour crude differentials have narrowed significantly, which is a negative for complex refiners because they lose their advantage of being able to process lower cost oils. Tesoro (TSO -4.3%%) trades lower on the report as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • CVX

    Chevron's (CVX -1.5%) move to boost 2012 capital spending by 26% to $32.7B came in higher than...

    Chevron's (CVX -1.5%) move to boost 2012 capital spending by 26% to $32.7B came in higher than expected, Barclays Capital tells clients. "While management had previously indicated 2012 spending would be above 2011, we think the shares may nevertheless come under short-term pressure due to the significant increase in expected cash outlays."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • SFD

    Smithfield Foods (SFD -2.6%) trades lower - most likely due to a bit of profit-taking off a new...

    Smithfield Foods (SFD -2.6%) trades lower - most likely due to a bit of profit-taking off a new 52-week high - despite its FQ2 results beating estimates. Earnings fell 16% Y/Y due to a significant jump in input costs, but the company adds that it's locked in above-normal profits for its hog-raising business for the rest of its fiscal year due to hedged positions in corn and pork.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • MLM

    Martin Marietta (MLM -4.3%) dips on a downgrade to Neutral from Buy on valuation at Longbow.

    Martin Marietta (MLM -4.3%) dips on a downgrade to Neutral from Buy on valuation at Longbow.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • F

    Ford (NYSE:F) shares resume trading after news of the reinstatement of a dividend, erasing more...

    Ford (NYSE:F) shares resume trading after news of the reinstatement of a dividend, erasing more than half of the day's loss, now -1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • UAL

    United (UAL -3.7%) dips after reporting a 3.6% drop in its total November traffic, declining to...

    United (UAL -3.7%) dips after reporting a 3.6% drop in its total November traffic, declining to around 15.56B revenue passenger miles, versus 16.15B revenue passenger miles in the year-ago period. Its total November capacity fell 4% to 19.16B available seat miles.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • LAYN

    Drilling-services company Layne Christensen (LAYN -4.4%) Q3 beats on revenue but comes up short...

    Drilling-services company Layne Christensen (LAYN -4.4%) Q3 beats on revenue but comes up short on a per share basis as margins were pressed by higher material costs. Net income rose 6.8% Y/Y on continued growth at its mining segment, but it warns of weakness in its water infrastructure business, its largest top-line earnings contributor. The company added that due to its lagging civil construction business the unit is expected to underperform next year as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • LVS

    Las Vegas Sands (LVS -5.1%) dips after being cut to Neutral at Janney Montgomery Scott, citing...

    Las Vegas Sands (LVS -5.1%) dips after being cut to Neutral at Janney Montgomery Scott, citing overly high expectations for profit growth in its Macau property and slower than expected near-term growth in Singapore.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • F

    Trading in Ford (F -3.2%) is halted with news pending. The Board of Directors is meeting today...

    Trading in Ford (F -3.2%) is halted with news pending. The Board of Directors is meeting today and there have been rumors about of a search for a new CEO, but it's unknown if this has anything to do with the halt.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • AUXL

    Specialty biopharmaceutical company Auxilium Pharmaceuticals (AUXL +4.9%) says its CEO and...

    Specialty biopharmaceutical company Auxilium Pharmaceuticals (AUXL +4.9%) says its CEO and President Armando Anido has agreed to step down and resign. Adrian Adams, most recently chairman and CEO of biotechnology firm Neurologix, has been appointed in his place. Adams has more than 30 years of experience in the pharmaceutical industry, and led Inspire Pharmaceuticals in its strategic acquisition by Merck.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • GEF

    Industrial packaging company Greif (GEF -3.8%) trades lower after its FQ4 beat estimates, but...

    Industrial packaging company Greif (GEF -3.8%) trades lower after its FQ4 beat estimates, but Y/Y earnings plummeted 73% on weaker margins and restructuring charges. The company also issued cautious guidance for FY12, saying challenges would continue into the first half of the new fiscal year due to continuing sluggishness in its European markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • MSG

    Shares of Madison Square Garden (MSG +2.5%) lift higher after Morgan Stanley shifts its rating...

    Shares of Madison Square Garden (MSG +2.5%) lift higher after Morgan Stanley shifts its rating to Overweight from Underweight. Analysts see the firm outperforming with the NBA lockout now in its rear-view mirror.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • DRC

    Oilfield-equipment manufacturer Dresser-Rand Group (DRC -2.1%) buys privately-held Synchrony for...

    Oilfield-equipment manufacturer Dresser-Rand Group (DRC -2.1%) buys privately-held Synchrony for $50m, adding a portfolio of advanced bearings, high-speed motors and generators to its stable of products.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • AFFY

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +41.3%) skyrockets following yesterday's recommendation by an FDA advisory...

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +41.3%) skyrockets following yesterday's recommendation by an FDA advisory panel for its peginesatide treatment of anemia in dialysis patients. Cowen believes the drug can capture $250M in U.S. sales by 2016, and Raymond James suspects AFFY can take market share if it prices its drug lower than Amgen's (AMGN +1%) Epogen.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • MEI

    Methode Electronics (MEI -7.5%) FQ2 beat on revenue but missed EPS estimates due to higher...

    Methode Electronics (MEI -7.5%) FQ2 beat on revenue but missed EPS estimates due to higher operational costs. Sales rose 7.6% Y/Y, but gross margins as a percentage of sales decreased to 15.3% from 19.3% due to higher R&D costs related to two North American automotive programs launching in FY12-13, plus increased costs related to vendor production and delivery issues.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • BTH

    Home decorations maker Blyth (BTH -14.3%) falls hard after reporting FQ3 revenue of $220.2M...

    Home decorations maker Blyth (BTH -14.3%) falls hard after reporting FQ3 revenue of $220.2M (+33% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.32 (no analyst estimates), and providing FY11 guidance. While Blyth is affirming its prior guidance for "normalized" 2011 EPS of $3.30-$3.50, it's lowering its "reported" guidace to $1.65-$1.85, from a prior range of $2.23-$2.43, and lowering its cash flow guidance due to the settlement of tax audits.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • DPZ

    Domino's Pizza (DPZ +3.1%) trades higher after the firm that runs the food chain in India...

    Domino's Pizza (DPZ +3.1%) trades higher after the firm that runs the food chain in India reports that an 11% price hike hasn't cut into demand. Pizza seems to be catching on in India, as the same firm projects 27% Y/Y growth for same store sales in the region.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • FXE

    The euro continues to slide, dropping below $1.33 for the first time since the Fed dollar swap...

    The euro continues to slide, dropping below $1.33 for the first time since the Fed dollar swap line news last week, and continuing a major reversal from a big move higher this morning. The catalyst was Mario Draghi squashing hopes (for now) of an ECB bazooka. FXE -0.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • IVC

    Shares of Invacare (IVC -20.8%) fall off after the FDA proposes the firm suspend operations at...

    Shares of Invacare (IVC -20.8%) fall off after the FDA proposes the firm suspend operations at several facilities until they reach full compliance.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • HP

    Goldman Sachs resumes coverage of oil service stocks (OIH -2%) with an Attractive rating, noting...

    Goldman Sachs resumes coverage of oil service stocks (OIH -2%) with an Attractive rating, noting that "U.S. land rig demand has just entered the second phase of a multi-year pickup." Helmerich & Payne (HP -1%) and Halliburton (HAL +0.8%), down 35% from its recent peak and priced near its historical cyclical-low multiples, are added to its Conviction Buy List.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • MDT

    Medtronic (MDT -2.5%) says it received a subpoena and request for documents from the California...

    Medtronic (MDT -2.5%) says it received a subpoena and request for documents from the California AG in connection with its controversial spine product Infuse. Studies were released earlier this month inferring a potential link between the bone fusion product and cancer.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • KFY

    Korn/Ferry (KFY -6.4%) FQ2 results beat on revenue but came up short on a per share basis as...

    Korn/Ferry (KFY -6.4%) FQ2 results beat on revenue but came up short on a per share basis as operating margins and fee revenue, although showing signs of improvement, continue to lag Street estimates. Additionally, the company cuts guidance for Q3, now seeing its EPS in the range of $0.25 to $0.33, below analysts' $0.35 per share consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • SQNS

    Sequans (SQNS +4.2%) has had a tough time carving a niche in the competitive (I, II, III) and...

    Sequans (SQNS +4.2%) has had a tough time carving a niche in the competitive (I, II, III) and R&D-intensive market for mobile baseband chips, but the company's investment in TD-LTE 4G technology, set to be deployed by China Mobile, Clearwire, and multiple Indian carriers, is showing signs of paying off. Shares are higher today after the chipmaker announced a deal with Indian OEM Telenet. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • PPC

    In an effort to improve its capital structure, Pilgrim's Pride (PPC -7.8%) announces plans to...

    In an effort to improve its capital structure, Pilgrim's Pride (PPC -7.8%) announces plans to launch a $200M, 44.4M share rights offering. Under the offering, shareholders of the poultry processor will be able to purchase common stock at $4.50 per share, representing a 5% discount to the 60-day weighted average price, and a 28% discount to Wednesday's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • AVP

    Avon's (AVP -1.9%) struggles have tended to obscure a nagging problem: It's nearly always short...

    Avon's (AVP -1.9%) struggles have tended to obscure a nagging problem: It's nearly always short on spare cash, due to a persistent and wipe gap between its free cash flow and income. Analysts say such gaps typically indicate that a company's investments aren't paying off very well - and "a warning sign about a future drop in earnings."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • AXL

    Shares of American Axle (AXL +2.5%) ride higher after catching an upgrade from Deutsche Bank to...

    Shares of American Axle (AXL +2.5%) ride higher after catching an upgrade from Deutsche Bank to Buy from Hold on "compelling" valuation and the strength of its strong backlog of $1.1B in orders covering 2012-2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • HIG

    Hartford Financial (HIG -6.2%) takes a hit after the company releases FY12 guidance at its...

    Hartford Financial (HIG -6.2%) takes a hit after the company releases FY12 guidance at its investor day this morning. The company expects its Q4 EPS to come in around $0.80 - $0.85 versus the Street consensus of $0.83, and FY12 EPS to be around $3.30 - $3.60, the lower range of estimates. The company also predicts a fragile economic recovery and persistent elevated unemployment in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • BAC

    Financials (XLF -2.5%) are suffering the most in early trading, in a steep slide that comes...

    Financials (XLF -2.5%) are suffering the most in early trading, in a steep slide that comes after the sector scored an outsized gain of 1.2% yesterday. Investors are ignoring the better-than-expected U.S. jobless claims report and focusing on the latest disappointment from Europe. Among big banks: BAC -2.7%, JPM -2.8%, C -4.8%, GS -2.3%, WFC -1.9%, MS -5.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 2 Comments
  • BRLI

    Bio-Reference Laboratories (BRLI +5.4%) gains after reporting Q3 results that beat estimates by...

    Bio-Reference Laboratories (BRLI +5.4%) gains after reporting Q3 results that beat estimates by a slim margin. The embattled firm says it expects to increase net revenues by more than 15% and net income by around 20% in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • IBM

    Unlike SAP/SuccessFactors, IBM's (IBM -0.3%) purchase of DemandTec (DMAN +55.4%) isn't providing...

    Unlike SAP/SuccessFactors, IBM's (IBM -0.3%) purchase of DemandTec (DMAN +55.4%) isn't providing a lift to most cloud software names - perhaps partly due to the relative narrow focus of DemandTec's solutions. However, rival SPS Commerce (SPSC +1.4%) is up slightly. IBM's acquisition is the latest in a string of analytics-related buys; other targets include Cognos, Netezza, Platform Computing, i2, Algorithmics, Q1 Labs, and OpenPages.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • CREE

    Cree (CREE -3.6%) shares are downgraded at Morgan Stanley, which contends the LED lighting...

    Cree (CREE -3.6%) shares are downgraded at Morgan Stanley, which contends the LED lighting company faces risks from industry-wide overcapacity, low factory utilization rates and difficult macro conditions.
